docs.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS, Feb. 11--The European Common Market today decided to give the approximately 400,000 doctors in its member countries the right to practice medicine wherever they want in the nine-nation community.

headline.main: Market Countries to Drop National Bars to Doctors; Market Countries Will Lower National Barriers for Doctors

docs.abstract: EEC decides to harmonize rules for export of pharmaceutical products within the community; under new system there will be single simplified procedure for testing and authorizing foreign drugs in each member country (M)
docs.snippet: BRUSSELS, Feb. 11--The European Common Market today decided to give the approximately 400,000 doctors in its member countries the right to practice medicine wherever they want in the nine-nation community.

byline.original: By PAUL KEMEZIS Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Public issues come and go, and surprisingly, one that has gone quietly is drug abuse.

headline.main: The Infinite Resilience of Drug Abuse

docs.abstract: Article, The Infinite Resilience of Drug Abuse, discusses proclamations of public officials within last few yrs that corner has been turned on drug abuse, particularly heroin addiction; cites statistics that tend to support their conclusions; discusses methods employed by authorities to cope with drug problem; holds there may be no answer to drug problem since legalization of drugs in other countries has given rise to new generation of amphetamine addicts; illus (L)
docs.snippet: Public issues come and go, and surprisingly, one that has gone quietly is drug abuse.
